definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to

sentences.english: The rules of Weiqi are very simple but there are countless variations of strategies.
sentences.chinese: 围棋的规则很简单，但是有数不尽的策略。

sentences.english: Countless surveys have shown that money doesn'tnecessarily lead to job satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 数不尽的调查显示薪水与工作满意度无关。

sentences.english: It involves manholes and endless ladders.
sentences.chinese: 通过人孔和数不尽的梯子。

sentences.english: Tonie has left us with countless memories and treasures.
sentences.chinese: 托力给我们留下了数不尽的美好记忆和精神财富。
同着数不尽的奴隶的凄苦。

sentences.english: They encountered untold difficulties and dangers before they reached their destination.
sentences.chinese: 他们经历过数不尽的艰难险阻才到达目的地。

sentences.english: The Chinese beautiful scenery are countless, old name Sichuan twofold day.
sentences.chinese: 中华胜景数不尽，中原名川两重天。

sentences.english: Things to see and things you can do is like unlimited in here.
sentences.chinese: 这里可看可做的事情好像数不尽似的。

definition: lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
continuous/unbroken/uninterrupted/extending forever into the distance (of mountain range, river etc)
lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
